articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime's War Hysteria Slammed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime's War Hysteria Slammed
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea Saturday gave the following answer to questions raised by KCNA as the Lee Myung Bak group toured a research institute for national defense and made public missiles developed by south Korea, kicking up war hysteria: 
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak, together with his warlike stooges, toured the research institute on April 19 where they went so ridiculous as to watch videos on the launch of missiles developed by south Korea.
					
					 The traitor asserted the need to access weapons for overpowering the north, saying that the north torpedoed the south's warship as it looked down on the south. The south Korean military cried out for "punishment" and "precision strike", while bragging the capacity of the missiles.
					
					 This was the hysteric fit of those who were shocked by the military power of the DPRK displayed through the military parade for celebrating the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Traitor Lee Myung Bak, military ignorant and political idiot, toured the research institute and made admonition. Greater irony is that he tried to use the 40 seconds video of missile launch in consoling his clan and relieving it of uneasiness and fear.
					
					 No wonder, south Koreans from all walk of life give sneering laugh at the puppet regime which made public the missiles.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK take no account of the puppet army, mercenary soldiers of the U.S. colony. If the south Korean warmongers make even a rustling sound, the armed forces of the DPRK will eradicate the rats and take hold of the land of the southern part of Korea.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak is sadly mistaken if he calculates he can survive in an air-raid shelter of Chongwadae no more than a rat-hole.
					
					Rats detrimental to human being must be exterminated.
					
					 Traitor Lee, more dead than alive, had better find his own grave, not clinging to reckless act.

articles.title: DFRK Spokesman Calls for Wiping out Lee Myung Bak Group
articles.content:
DFRK Spokesman Calls for Wiping out Lee Myung Bak Group
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea (DFRK) in a statement on Saturday declared that the army and people of the DPRK would wipe out the group of rat-like Lee Myung Bak to the last man as it runs with blood-shot eyes, committing acts of treachery and escalating confrontation with the soul of the nation thrown away.
					 Saying that the army and people of the DPRK are trembling with towering indignation and hatred for the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors who again committed a thrice-cursed high treason against the nation and history, the statement went on:
					
					 Whoever is a member of the Korean nation must be well aware of how the rays of resurrection reached the land of distress which was once eclipsed on the world map and how the Korean nation which was suffering the miserable fate as a colonial slave became great and the strongest nation in the world.
					
					 No wonder, all the Koreans have missed so much the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu, benefactor of the Koreans and the sun of the nation who cleared them of their grief as members of a stateless nation, calling back with pride on the 100 year noble history of Juche era.
					
					 The Koreans' warm loyalty and reverence for the great persons are incalculable with money and immeasurable with any yardstick. However, the Lee group had temerity to try to measure them with money only to prove that it is made up of savages who turned their backs on the genuine human world. 
					
					 Its recent hideous provocation is no more than hysteric fit of those on the deathbed as they were horror-stricken by the tremendous might of the army and the people of the DPRK who are dynamically advancing toward a final victory keeping pace with the giant footsteps of the supreme leader, firmly holding the arms of the revolution in hands.
					
					 No matter how hard the rat-like vicious Lee Myung Bak group without equal in the world tries to do harm to the unbreakable single-minded unity in the DPRK, the DPRK remains unfazed. This will only touch off bitterer hatred and resentment among its service personnel and people at their sworn enemies.
					
					 Traitor Lee is human scum and half-wit as he is so steeped in sycophancy and submission to the marrow of his bones that he has neither an iota of national identity nor elementary sense of obligation. It is, therefore, a tragedy and shame for the nation to see Lee still alive.
					
					  The world will clearly see what merciless and severe punishment all the service personnel and the people of the DPRK will mete out to the rat-like Lee group going reckless, challenging the Heaven, and what miserable end it will face.

articles.title: Congratulations from Syrian President
articles.content:
Congratulations from Syrian President
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a congratulatory message from Syrian President Bashar Al-Assad on April 18.
					 The message said:
					
					 Warmly congratulating Your Excellency, and through you, the leadership body of the Workers' Party of Korea and friendly Korean people as regards the fact that H.E. leader Kim Jong Il who is living an eternal life is held in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the WPK and Your Excellency was elected first secretary of the WPK and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, I wish you success in your noble duty.
					
					 Your election as first secretary of the WPK and supreme leader of the army and people is an expression of the trust of the leadership body and people of your country in you and revelation of the will to realize on higher level the cause of the Party, revolution, country and people and global independence which H.E. Kim Il Sung, founder and eternal President of the DPRK, hewed out and H.E. Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the WPK, inherited.
					
					 Availing myself of this happy opportunity, I express conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between our two countries would continue to strengthen in the interests of the peoples of the two friendly countries.
					
					 Extending sincere congratulations to Your Excellency once again, I wish you good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Congratulations from General Secretary of Lao Political Party
articles.content:
Congratulations from General Secretary of Lao Political Party
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Friday received a congratulatory message from Lao President Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and chairman of the Central Committee of Defence and Security of Laos.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to you on your election as first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK at the fifth session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK on April 13, 2012.
					
					 Your election to the top post of the country is an expression of the absolute trust in you of the party, government and people of the DPRK.
					
					 I am convinced that the government and people of the DPRK would register greater and fresh achievements in accomplishing the cause of building a thriving socialist nation under the outstanding and wise guidance of the WPK headed by you.
					
					 I hope the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop in the interests of the two peoples.
					
					 I wish you happiness in good health as well as successes in accomplishing noble cause.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Olympic Committee led by Son Kwang Ho, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and a delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea led by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of the C.C., the Union, came back home by air on Saturday.
					 Meanwhile, foreign art troupes, acrobatic groups and delegations left here after participating in the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Okayama Prefectural Society for the Promotion of Japan-Korea Friendship led by Seisuke Mihara, representative of the Association for Promotion of Friendship between Japan and North and South Korea,  arrived here on Saturday.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Statue and Grave of Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Statue and Grave of Kang Pan Sok
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the statue of Kang Pan Sok, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the Korean women's movement, in the Chilgol Revolutionary Site and her grave in Mangyongdae on Saturday on the occasion of her 120th birth anniversary.
					 Seen before the statue and grave were wreaths sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 Wreath-laying ceremonies were attended by senior party, state and army officials including Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim and Ri Yong Ho and the chairperson of a friendly party, leading officials of party and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and education and media fields, servicepersons and Pyongyang citizens.
					
					Wreaths in the name of the WPK Central Committee, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet were placed there.
					
					 Also placed there were wreaths in the name of working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, military academies, revolutionary schools, educational and media institutions and party and power bodies and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to her, looking back on her noble life.

articles.title: South Phyongan and Hamgyong Provinces Vow to Wipe out Lee Group
articles.content:
South Phyongan and Hamgyong Provinces Vow to Wipe out Lee Group
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons and people in South Phyongan and Hamgyong provinces of the DPRK met on Saturday to wipe out the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group, the sworn enemy, in this land.
					 Present there were officials of party and power organs and working people's organizations, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, people of different social standings and youth and students in the provinces.
					
					 The statement issued by a spokesman for the KPA Supreme Command was read out to be followed by speeches by representatives of service personnel, workers, agricultural workers, youth and students and women.
					
					 The speakers labeled rat-like Lee Myung Bak as a typical underwit and imbecile as he described the DPRK's launch of satellite as a product of "arms race". Lee learned craftiness and disposition as a waste dealer in Japan when he was young and now has become a special class stooge of the U.S. and Japanese masters, they said.
					
					 It is a shame for the service personnel and people of the DPRK to wrest an apology from the rat-like Lee too feeble to be beaten and trodden to death, the speakers added.
					
					 Describing Lee as a disgusting rat inside the dumping group, they declared that he had better leave this world, though belatedly, as demanded by the people. 
					
					 The nation will not escape misfortune, much less seeing the improved north-south relations, as long as rat- like Lee who considers confrontation with his fellow countrymen as the way of existence is allowed to stay in power, they stated, and went on:
					
					 The aged reactionaries no better than paupers going reckless like a tiger moths, patronized by rat-like Lee group, gangster-like students, human scum, as well as the ultra-right conservative media can never escape the merciless strikes by the army of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 It is the top principle of the DPRK to devotedly protect the leader and it does not allow any slightest compromise. The Lee group more dead than alive will face a final severe punishment. 
					
					 Then followed protest demonstrations.

articles.title: DPRK Servicepersons Angered by S. Korean Regime's Insult
articles.content:
DPRK Servicepersons Angered by S. Korean Regime's Insult
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea defamed the celebrations for the Day of the Sun (April 15) held in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and went the length of insulting the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 The thrice-cursed crimes have driven the men and officers of the Korean People's Army into great fury.
					
					 A KPA general officer, Kim Yong Gwang, told KCNA after attending the Pyongyang city army-people rally vowing to wipe out the Lee group of rats:
					
					 "We can hardly repress surging indignation at their behaviors.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak, a dirty rat inferior to a dog, dared slander the Sun with his tongue used to lick his master's shoes.
					
					 This bastard can never be allowed to exist in this land. We will reduce this rat into ashes."
					
					 A KPA officer, Ji Il Hyok, said:
					
					 "Disgusting Myung Bak egged wicked conservative media and paid plot-breeding bodies of south Korea on to call the celebrations of the Day of the Sun 'extravagant spree'.
					
					 He is a bastard living on dregs thrown by foreign forces and a dirty guy without parallel in the world. We will tear this rat to pieces to vent our pent-up spite without fail."
					
					 A KPA officer, Ha Jong Nyo, said:
					
					 "I was honored to take part in the military parade held in the presence of Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the KPA.
					
					 Looking up to him, we soldiers resolved to dash towards the south to kill the Lee Myung Bak group of rats to the last one if he gives an order.
					
					 We will mercilessly destroy those dirty rats with arms."

articles.title: Pyongyangites, Infuriated at Hysterical Acts of S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
Pyongyangites, Infuriated at Hysterical Acts of S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang citizens are now trembling with anger at south Korea's Lee Myung Bak group of rats that dared defame again the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					 Kim Yong, head of a workshop at the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory, told KCNA:
					
					 "The rat-like Lee Myung Bak, not worth a penny, kicked up a smear campaign to desecrate the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					
					 This act of rat Myung Bak, who styles himself a statesman, reminds us of a ditch-finding rat floundering in water.
					
					 The wretched look of Lee asking for help seems to be visible to me. 
					
					 There is a saying that a stick is fit for a mad dog. But I can never find out an alternative to such a variety of rats, even in the Korean Encyclopedia."
					
					 Hwang Kum Son, a 42-year-old woman living in Moranbong District, said:
					
					 There is only one thing that awaits rat-faced Lee Myung Bak who sneaks around only in dark places and works mischievously.
					
					 This rat called Lee smells only of malodor. Even a hungry cat would not eat this stenchy rat after killing it. 
					
					 My young children asked me to let them know how to catch a rat.
					
					 I am sure that his brain is filled with dirt. There is no other place but a dust bin for the rat-like Myung Bak to stay."

articles.title: Socialist Emulation Drive Called for in DPRK
articles.content:
Socialist Emulation Drive Called for in DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The working people's organizations of the DPRK at rallies on Friday called on workers, trade union members, agricultural workers and women's union members across the country to conduct a socialist emulation drive for the Prize of Flames of Hamnam.
					 Speakers at the rallies called for upholding the dear respected Kim Jong Un as the center of unity and leadership, true to the behest of leader Kim Jong Il, and making the flame of Hamnam flare up throughout the country.
					
					 They called for making a breakthrough in the advance for effecting a surge and launching a campaign for keeping the production going at a high rate. 
					
					 They urged the need to over-fulfill the grain production plan for this year to bring the desire of the peerless great men and the noble intention of Kim Jong Un into a reality.
					
					 An appeal was read out at the rallies.

articles.title: Foreign Artistes Eager to Attend Next April Art Festival
articles.content:
Foreign Artistes Eager to Attend Next April Art Festival
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- "We would like to attend the art festival again."
					 This is what the famous artistes' group of Bulgaria's "Orfei" Opera Troupe said after participating in the 28th April Spring Friendship Art Festival.
					
					 All members of the group are international concours winners. They have been welcomed in several countries including Germany and France.
					
					 At the festival they put on the stage Korean songs "Cantata to Comrade Kim Jong Il", "Forest Is Swaying" and "Let's Go to Mountains and Sea" with rich voice and high artistry to win high acclamation from the audience.
					
					 During the festival they came to get better understanding of the Korean people's emotion.
					
					 Especially, they were struck with admiration at the well-furnished music hall of the Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory.
					
					 Peter Ilier Buchkov, head of the group, told KCNA:
					
					 "I was deeply moved to see the conservatory, whose music hall is equipped with excellent sound facilities.
					
					  It is our happiness to have given our performance at the 28th Art Festival. And we hope to come again for the next festival."

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak-led Swarm of Rats Deserves Punishment: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak-led Swarm of Rats Deserves Punishment: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- It is fixed determination of the army and people of the DPRK to ruthlessly beat to death the swarm of rats bossed by Lee Myung Bak bereft of communication ability as human being, says Minju Joson Saturday in a bylined commentary.
					 It says the traitors should pay a price with their lives for having insulted the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and found fault with its social system.
					
					 It goes on to say:
					
					 The group has gone imprudent enough to take into financial account the festivities of the Day of the Sun admired by all the world people, making desperate efforts to desecrate the social system of the DPRK and the dignity of its supreme leadership and damage the single-minded unity, the commentary notes, adding this only betrays the disgusting nature of the group of misers.
					
					 The group's smear campaign is just a last-ditch effort in fear of the might of the DPRK's single-minded unity and powerful military strength that were demonstrated through the celebrations of the Day of the Sun, and a desperate attempt to quell the world people's enthusiastic cheers for a solemn declaration that signaled an emergence of a new era of successful inheritance. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK get themselves fully ready to make the group pay a dear price for its provocations, and deal a merciless attack of revenge to it.
					
					 The world will see what a strong attack of revenge the group will sustain, concludes the commentary.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmongers' Firing Drill Ridiculed
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmongers' Firing Drill Ridiculed
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The puppet army staged a test-fire drill of MLRS in the forefront area of south Korean Kangwon Province, according to south Korean KBS Friday.
					 The warmongers set up artillery pieces in an area no more than 10km away from the north side and frantically fired dozens of shells.
					
					 They trumpeted that this drill served a warning that they would resolutely and severely punish the north in case of its provocation.
					
					 Puppet Defense Minister Kim Kwang Jin made bluffing before media persons that south Korea would counter the north with new and more powerful weapons.
					
					 On Thursday the warmongers opened a new-type missile to media, fanning up war hysteria.
					
					 Such reckless behavior of the puppet group is no more than its last-ditch effort to evade the responsibility for having touched off the nation's resentment through its ceaseless hideous provocations.

articles.title: Legal Settlement of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Demanded
articles.content:
Legal Settlement of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Demanded
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps of south Korea at a press conference in Seoul on Wednesday demanded a legal settlement of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. 
					 An open written request to traitor Lee Myung Bak was read out at the press conference. 
					
					 It accused Lee Myung Bak of asserting recently that the issue of comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army "should be settled in a humanitarian way rather than by law". This backs the stand of the Japanese government which has denied the legal responsibility for the above-said sexual slavery, it said, adding:
					
					 The present regime should not talk about humanitarianism but demand Japan legally settle the issue so that the honor and human rights of the victims of the sexual slavery may be restored.

articles.title: Actions against Dictatorship Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against Dictatorship Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification in a statement on April 19 called for turning out in actions against the dictatorial forces in the spirit of April 19 uprising.
					 The uprising put an end to the fascist rule of Syngman Rhee dictatorial regime and the spirit displayed by its participants has been carried forward still today, the statement said.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye undisguisedly set in motion the government power, spread lies through media, staged black propaganda and mobilized military for "National Assembly" election as Syngman Rhee did in the past, it deplored.
					
					 The present situation calls for frustrating their rigged election and media propaganda moves in the same way as the Syngman Rhee dictatorial regime was pulled down, it noted, calling on all people to get united to firmly stand against the dictatorial forces in the spirit of the April 19 uprising.

articles.title: Pomminryon South Headquarters Calls for Turning Out for Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Pomminryon South Headquarters Calls for Turning Out for Independent Reunification
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) Wednesday made public a statement titled "Let us fully display the spirit of the April south-north joint conference". 
					 The statement said that the joint conference of representatives of political parties and public organizations in north and south of Korea in Pyongyang in April 1948, 64 years ago, was a nationwide gathering to frustrate the two Koreas scheme of the U.S. and Syngman Rhee. 
					
					 The statement called for holding higher the banner of "By Korean nation itself", banner of independence against imperialism in the spirit of the joint conference in line with the will and desire of the entire nation for building a reunified independent and sovereign state. 
					
					 It called upon all the south Korean people to turn out in the great dynamic advance for independent reunification holding aloft the banner of the great national unity.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung Celebrated in Chiba Prefecture
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung Celebrated in Chiba Prefecture
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A meeting for the promotion of friendship between the DPRK and Japan in Chiba Prefecture was held in Japan on April 8 as part of celebration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Present there were Ha Su Gwang, chairman of the Chiba Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Paek Jong Il, president of the Chiba Prefectural Commercial Association, and other compatriots, members of the Hunaba City Assembly and Japanese people from all walks of life.
					
					 Ha Su Gwang took the floor first to be followed by Japanese people.
					
					 The participants called for pooling efforts for the promotion of friendship between the two countries.
					
					 A reception was given on the same day.

articles.title: Celebrations Held in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Celebrations Held in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan held a meeting at the Korean Center, Bishkek  on April 15, the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.  
					 Present there were Pak Kyong Ho, chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan, officials and compatriots.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the vice-president of the Union of Kyrgyz Societies for Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries and members of the group for the study of the Juche idea in Kyrgyzstan.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the portraits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il in an office of Kothongryon and made bows.
					
					 Pak Kyong Ho in an address said that Generalissimo Kim Il Sung was the greatest man revered by the world.
					
					 His great revolutionary feats and august name will remain shining in the hearts of all the people in the world, Pak noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that revolutionary cause pioneered by the President will be carried forward without fail thanks to the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 An art performance was given by artistes of compatriots.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, April 20 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "On the Three Principles of National Reunification" was brought out in booklet by the Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia on April 11.
					 The work, published on May 3 and Nov. 3, 1972, deals with the three principles of national reunification -- independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity -- and the idea of achieving cooperation between the north and the south of Korea.
						
						 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) --The Futra Publishing House in the Czech Republic published in pamphlet the work of leader Kim Jong Il "Let Us Hold the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung in High Esteem as Eternal President of Our Republic."
					
					 This work, published on July 11 and 19, 1994, underscores the need to hold President Kim Il Sung in high esteem forever as he was in his lifetime and clarifies the tasks for preserving and successfully carrying forward and developing his idea and immortal exploits.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on April 10.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Guinea
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "3. Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully" from "Report to the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea on the Work of the Central Committee" was brought out in booklet by the La Soldarite Publishing House of Guinea.
					 The work, published on October 10, 1980, reviews the struggle of the WPK for national reunification during the period under review and sets forth tasks for achieving independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 It puts forth a new reunification proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo on the three principles for national reunification and lays down the 10-point policy to be carried out by the DFRK.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony was held at the publishing house on April 10.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Marked in Cuba, Russia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary Marked in Cuba, Russia
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by Cuban artistes at a theater in Havana and a joint performance by DPRK and Russia youth and students at Far-Eastern State University for Communications in Khabarovsk on April 2 and 12 in celebration of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Put on the stages of the performances that started with chorus "Song of General Kim Il Sung", immortal revolutionary hymn, were Korean songs including "Mangyongdae, the Cradle of Revolution" and "Footsteps" and songs and dances of Cuba and Russia.
					
					 Among the audiences were officials concerned including the Cuban vice-minister of Culture, the president, teachers and students of the Russian university and staff members of the DPRK missions in Cuba and Russia.

articles.title: Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibitions Held in Russia
articles.content:
Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibitions Held in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibitions took place in Nakhodka and Vladivostok, Russia on April 6 and 10 to celebrate the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at the venues were many immortal flowers in full bloom.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremonies were mayors and deputy mayors of the Nakhodka, Vladivostok, Pokino and Partizansk city administrations of Russia and officials of different social standings and other people. 
					
					 Speeches were made at the ceremonies.
					
					 The director of the Nakhodka City Greening Office of Russia said that Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia are symbols of reverence of all people for the peerlessly great men.
					
					 The director expressed belief that the flower of the sun carrying the august name of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, another great man, will certainly bloom on the earth before long.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised as Distinguished Statesman in 20th Century
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised as Distinguished Statesman in 20th Century
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Political party and organizations of different countries posted on their Internet websites special write-ups on April 6 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Communist Party of the Russian Federation carried an article praising the President's revolutionary career with his photo.
					
					 The Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea praised him as the most distinguished state leader and the great thinker and theoretician in the 20th century. 
					
					 It posted on its website the immortal revolutionary paean "Song of General Kim Il Sung" with the portrait of a smiling President and photos of his revolutionary activities.
					
					 The Finland-Korea Society edited an article of similar content.
					
					 The Society for the Promotion of the Relations Between Austria and DPRK posted on its website articles titled " Kim Il Sung -- shining august name", "Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un and guards division" and "Songun politics and Korean Peninsula" with photos of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association in an article said that the President is enjoying boundless reverence among the Korean and world progressive peoples as a distinguished statesman and the great sun in the 20th century as he performed feats for the era and history.
					
					 He is always alive with mankind just as the sun is everlasting, the article added.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Undying Feats Reported by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Undying Feats Reported by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's undying feats were reported by foreign media between April 3 and 5 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 Onda Rossa of Italy in an article titled "President Kim Il Sung, great thinker, outstanding statesman and ever-victorious strategist" said that the President founded the Juche idea to further enrich the treasure house of human thought and clearly indicated the way to be followed by the progressives.
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al Ahrar carried articles titled "Founder of socialist Korea" and "DPRK in 2012" which praised the undying ideological and theoretical feats and revolutionary leadership feats of the President.
					
					 The MS Tourism Company of Germany posted on its Internet website an article saying the august name of Kim Il Sung is a symbol of the national liberation and the era of independence, noble virtues and pure moral obligation as well as banner of eternal victory.
					
					 The French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Songun Idea posted on its Internet website articles headlined "Greatest wish of President Kim Il Sung" and "The Juche idea indicating the way of hewing out human destiny".
					
					 The Cuban paper Granma on April 14 in an article said that the President is enjoying boundless reverence among the Korean and world peoples as he performed the undying feats for the revolution.
					
					 Another paper of Cuba Juventud Rebelde on the same day noted that the President devoted his whole life to building an independent and creative country and put forward the popular masses as the master of their own destiny and history.

articles.title: US and West's Pressure on Iran's Nuclear Program Slammed
articles.content:
US and West's Pressure on Iran's Nuclear Program Slammed
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the West's pressure on Iran's peaceful nuclear program is rendering the situation in the Mideast region extremely tense.
					 The U.S. recently took a measure to freeze assets of financial organizations of Iran including Iran Central Bank in the U.S.
					
					 The EU adopted a decision to ban Iran's use of international remittance network, toeing the U.S. line.
					
					 This has made 116 members including relevant officials of the Iranian government and 442 enterprises and organizations including Iran Central Bank unable to use the international remittance network in EU countries.
					
					 The Iranian government stopped oil export to six EU countries in protest against the sanctions and pressure, warning that if oil export of the country is blocked, it would block up Hormuz Strait.
					
					 In fact, Iran successfully conducted long-range missile test launch through various military drills in Hormuz Strait and demonstrated the will to build a new naval base near the strait to cope with military attack by the U.S. and the West.
					
					 The U.S. and the West's reckless sanctions and pressure against Iran drew strong protest and denunciation of the international community.
					
					 Russian Prime Minister Putin expressed his opposition to the reckless military attack on Iran, calling upon the international community to recognize Iran's right of peaceful nuclear development and solving its nuclear issue in a peaceful way.
					
					 Premier of the State Council of China Wen Jiabao said that the military attack on Iran will wreak greater havoc with the Mideast and the rest of the world. 
					
					 Prime Minister of Jordan Awn Khasawneh said that this will push backward the development of the region for decades.
					
					 Sheikh Sabah Al Khalid Al Hamad Al Sabah, deputy prime minister and foreign minister of Kuwait, said that Kuwait will not offer its sky, land and sea as a base of attack on Iran, adding that Iran's nuclear issue should be solved through dialogue, not by other means.
					
					 The Armenian foreign minister expressed the country's stand against the military attack on Iran.

articles.title: Iran Ready to Give Crushing Deal to Aggressors: Iranian President
articles.content:
Iran Ready to Give Crushing Deal to Aggressors: Iranian President
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on April 17 said that Iranian Army is capable of giving a crushing deal to any aggression that endangers the nation's interests.
					 He said the capability of Iranian Army had grown to a higher level despite sanctions and clandestine moves of the enemies, adding if the country's territory and interests are violated, the army will give bitter disgrace to the aggressors. 
					
					 He stressed that the Iranian armed forces are fully ready to defend its sovereignty and the regional stability.

articles.title: Cuba Calls for L. American Unity in Defiance of US
articles.content:
Cuba Calls for L. American Unity in Defiance of US
 Havana, April 20 (KCNA) -- Cuba called for Latin American and Caribbean countries to maintain unity amid U.S. attempts to sow division in the region, the official daily Granma said Wednesday.
					 An article in the newspaper titled "For the Second Independence" said, "Faced with U.S. attempts to divide and defeat us, Latin America needs to remain united."

articles.title: Indonesian President Underscores Need to Anticipate Earthquake, Tsunami
articles.content:
Indonesian President Underscores Need to Anticipate Earthquake, Tsunami
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Indonesian President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono on Monday instructed relevant institutions to compose a master plan to anticipate earthquake and tsunami in the future.
					 As part of the master plan Yudhoyono also approved additional infrastructures for tsunami early warning such as sirens, tsunami buoy, tidal wave equipments, global positioning system and others.
					
					 It is expected that the master plan could be completed in the next 1-2 months.

articles.title: Colombian President Calls for End of Cold War Policy on Cuba
articles.content:
Colombian President Calls for End of Cold War Policy on Cuba
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos in his address at a regional meeting on Apr. 14 urged the U.S. to adopt a new policy toward Cuba, ending the decades-old practice of isolation, embargo and indifference.
					  "We remain tied to a policy from the Cold War, which has been over for years," Santos said.

articles.title: Chilean FM Blames US for Hindering Regional Unity
articles.content:
Chilean FM Blames US for Hindering Regional Unity
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Chilean Foreign Minister Alfredo Moreno Monday bitterly denounced the U.S. for hindering the unity of regional countries.
					 The United States rejected Cuba's participation in any future OAS summits, he said, branding this as the absurd acts blocking the unity of regional countries. 
					
					 The United States hindered any possibility of reaching a consensus at the Americas regional summit, he added.

articles.title: Palestinians' Sit-ins in Lebanon Demand Release of Detainees in Israel
articles.content:
Palestinians' Sit-ins in Lebanon Demand Release of Detainees in Israel
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Palestinians held sit-ins in front of humanitarian institution offices in Tripoli on the eve of the Palestinian Prisoners' Day on April 16.
					 Representatives of different Palestinian factions participated in the sit-ins.
					
					 They showed solidarity with their fellowmen prisoned in Israel and urged the Israeli authorities to immediately release the detainees.

articles.title: Palestinians Call for Release of Prisoners in Israel
articles.content:
Palestinians Call for Release of Prisoners in Israel
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) in an official statement on Monday strongly urged the Israeli authorities to release prisoners jailed in Israel. 
					 The press statement of the PLO foreign relations department said the prisoners in Israel "will remain the central issue for the Palestinian people," adding that "there will be no peace or settlement in the region without the complete release of all the prisoners." 
					
					 The statement called for the launch of a solidarity campaign for the prisoners, who decided to hunger strike to raise their demand for better prison conditions.

articles.title: Iran Arrests 15 Israel-linked Spies: Intelligence Ministry
articles.content:
Iran Arrests 15 Israel-linked Spies: Intelligence Ministry
 Teheran, April 20 (KCNA) -- Iranian Intelligence Ministry said in a statement issued on Tuesday that in recent operations by Iranian intelligence forces, 15 people, both Iranians and foreigners who are linked to an Israeli spy cell have been detained, the local satellite Press TV reported Wednesday.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- China and Vietnam agreed to further improve bilateral military ties on April 16.
					 On the same day China and Tunisia pledged closer friendly and cooperative relations between the two nations in various fields.

articles.title: Earthquakes Strike Indonesia
articles.content:
Earthquakes Strike Indonesia
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- A 5.7-magitude quake jolted the eastern part of Indonesia on Apr. 16.
					 The epicenter was registered at 82km southeast of South Sulawesi Province.
					
					 Another quake with magnitude of 5.9 hit Aceh Province on the same day with epicenter at 497km southwest Simeulue of the province.

articles.title: Britain's Jobless Rate Is 8.3 Pct
articles.content:
Britain's Jobless Rate Is 8.3 Pct
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Unemployment rate in Britain was 8.3 percent in the three months to February, said the Office for National Statistics (ONS) on Wednesday.
					 The official figures showed that unemployment was 2.65 million in the December-February period.

articles.title: Japan Records Biggest Trade Deficit in Fiscal 2011
articles.content:
Japan Records Biggest Trade Deficit in Fiscal 2011
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Japan's trade deficit in the past fiscal year ending in March stood at 4.41 trillion yen (about 54.19 billion U.S. dollars), marking the worst ever reading for the country, the Finance Ministry said Thursday.

articles.title: US, Japanese Companies under Depression
articles.content:
US, Japanese Companies under Depression
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Citigroup Monday reported profit declines for the first quarter as the revenue came in at 19.4 billion dollars, lower than 19.7 billion dollars a year earlier.
					 The amount of power generated and purchased by Japan's 10 utilities in FY 2011 fell 5.1 percent from a year earlier, an industry body said.

articles.title: Fidel Castro on End of US-style Imperialism
articles.content:
Fidel Castro Predicts End of US-style Imperialism
 Havana, April 20 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro, leader of the Cuban revolution, in an article on Tuesday predicted the end of U.S.-style imperialism.
					 U.S.-style imperialism has outlived its days and it can no longer exist in Latin America, the article said.
					
					 The U.S. will not easily give up its control over regional countries' territories, seas, mines and natural resources, it noted, strongly urging the U.S. to close military bases in Latin America and stop at once biased trade and plunder.

articles.title: Russia, Turkey Hit by Natural Disasters
articles.content:
Russia, Turkey Hit by Natural Disasters
 Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Different parts of the Central Federal District and the Federal District along the River Bolga of Russia were hit by flooding recently. 
					 The flood left at least 3,000 houses in six areas inundated as of April 16. More than 1,300 inhabitants were evacuated to safe places.
					
					 The number of the victims is estimated to be nearly 6,000. 
					
					 Meanwhile, heavy windstorm affected parts of Turkey on Wednesday, the semi-official Anatolia news agency reported.
					
					 In Istanbul, where the wind speed reached 90 km per hour, the traffic were badly affected, with dozens of cars moving slowly on the Bosphorus Bridge, Anatolia said.
					
					 Many scheduled passenger ships had to either postpone or cancel trips due to the strong winds in Istanbul.

articles.title: Vocero de CRPP condena belicismo de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Vocero de CRPP condena belicismo de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Recientemente, la banda de Lee Myung Bak volvio a exponer su fiebre belicista dando a la publicidad los misiles desarrollados por si misma durante la visita al instituto de ciencias de defensa nacional.
					Con respecto a ese tema, el vocero del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria concedio una rueda de prensa con la ACNC y dio la siguiente respuesta:
					
					El 19, el traidor Lee Myung Bak y sus lacayos belicosos visitaron el instituto de ciencias de defensa nacional y expusieron ridiculamente su fiebre belicista viendo un video sobre el lanzamiento de misiles desarrollados por si mismos.
					
					En esa ocasion, Lee dijo que el Norte (RPDC) ataca el buque surcoreano porque subestima al Sur y necesitan por eso las armas superiores a las del Norte. Y sus compinches del circulo militar pronunciaron unas palabras fanfarroneadas, tales como "castigo correspondiente" y "ataque de precision", hablando de la eficiencia de sus misiles.
					
					Tal chismografia constituye la histeria de los que tienen panico al poderio militar de la RPDC manifestado en el reciente desfile militar en homenaje al centenario del natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					
					Es muy ridiculo que Lee, iletrado en los asuntos militares y politicos, haya dado instrucciones durante su visita al instituto mencionado y pretendido consolar a sus compinches atemorizados exhibiendo un video de 40 segundos nada mas.
					
					Los mismos habitantes surcoreanos estan burlandose de esa payasada.
					
					Las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias de la RPDC ni siquiera toman en consideracion al ejercito titere surcoreano, mercenario colonial de EE.UU., y exterminaran, a modo de la caza de ratones, a los belicistas surcoreanos si estos dan algun movimiento sospechoso y tomaran el suelo surcoreano aprovechando esa oportunidad.
					
					Estaria muy equivocado Lee Myung Bak si piensa poder salvarse si se esconde en el refugio subterraneo de Chongwadae, igual a una ratonera.
					
					Hay que matar a todos los ratones inutiles y perjudiciales al hombre.
					
					Lee, cadaver vivo, debera pensar primero en su sepultura en lugar de incurrir en acciones inutiles.

articles.title: FDRP declara exterminar a la banda ratonesca de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
FDRP declara exterminar a la banda ratonesca de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- En su nota publicada este sabado, el portavoz del Comite Central del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria declaro exterminar a la banda ratonesca de Lee Myung Bak que marcha demencialmente por la senda de traicion y enfrentamiento echando por la tierra el espiritu nacional. 
					En estos dias, el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea vibran de indignacion y enemistad, informados de que la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak cometio otro imperdonable crimen ante la nacion y la historia, comienza el portavoz y continua:
					
					Si es un miembro de la nacion coreana, conoceria de sobra como este pais, que sufria martirios nacionales siendo opacado en el mapa mundial, acogio el tiempo de renacimiento, y como nuestra nacion, que vivia tragicamente como esclava colonial, se convirtio en la mas grande y fuerte del mundo.
					
					Por eso, al recordar con orgullos la sagrada centuria de la Era Juche, todos los coreanos anoran tanto a los grandes hombres sin pares del monte Paektu, salvadores y Sol de la nacion coreana, que dieron punto final a la tristeza de apatrida.
					
					Realmente, son bestias, que dejaron de ser humanos, los compinches del traidor Lee Myung Bak que calculan mezquinamente con el dinero la fidelidad de la nacion coreana y el alma de veneracion a los grandes hombres, las cuales no se pueden valorar ni con montones de oro.
					
					Los presentes tremendos actos provocativos no pasan de ser una desesperacion histerica de quien esta consternado al extremo ante el inagotable poderio del ejercito y el pueblo coreanos que avanzan  a pasas firmes hacia la victoria final siguiendo los pasos del Maximo Dirigente con los fusiles de la revolucion llenos de odio.
					
					Aunque la horda de ratones de Lee Myung Bak intenta descomponer nuestra unidad monolitica nunca podra quebrantarla y sus actos redoblaran solo el odio y la indignacion contra los enemigos jurados.
					
					Es una tragedia y verguenza de la nacion la existencia del traidor Lee, tipo mas asqueroso y deformado humano que se aferra al servilismo a las grandes potencias y la subyugacion, carente de la nacionalidad y la mas elemental obligacion del ser humano.
					
					El mundo presenciara cuan despiadado y destructivo es el castigo de represalia de todos ejercito y pueblo y como terminara el destino de la esta horda de ratones de Lee que actua con imprudencia.

articles.title: Depositadas ofrendas florales ante estatua de bronce de Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Depositadas ofrendas florales ante estatua de bronce de Kang Pan Sok
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 120o aniversario del nacimiento de la indoblegable combatiente revolucionaria y destacada dirigente del movimiento femenino de Corea, Kang Pan Sok, fueron depositadas el dia 21 las ofrendas florales ante la estatua de bronce de ella erguida en el lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Chilgol y su tumba en Mangyongdae. 
					Estaban colocadas en los respectivos lugares las ofrendas florales enviadas por Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea y Maximo Dirigente del PTC y el pueblo coreano. 
					
					En las ocasiones estuvieron presentes Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Ri Yong Ho y otros cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, el presidente de partido amigo, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido y el poder, entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales y ramas de educacion, prensa e informacion, los oficiales y soldados del EPC junto con los trabajadores capitalinos. 
					
					Fueron puestas ante la estatua de bronce y la tumba de ella las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC. 
					
					Tambien se veian las otras a nombre de las entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, academias militares, escuelas revolucionarias, instituciones de educacion, prensa e informacion, los organos del partido y el poder y granjas en la capital. 
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio recordando la noble vida de Kang Pan Sok.

articles.title: Prosiguen mitines de condena en las provincias coreanas
articles.content:
Prosiguen mitines de condena en las provincias coreanas
Pyongyang, 21 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 21 los mitines de militares y civiles en las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur y Hamgyong del Sur para jurar la liquidacion de la banda de ratones de Lee Myung Bak, enemigo jurado.
					 A las ocasiones asistieron los funcionarios de los organos locales del partido y el poder, las entidades de masas, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los trabajadores de diferentes sectores, los jovenes y estudiantes.
					
					 Despues de leida la ultima declaracion del portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del EPC, pronunciaron discursos los representantes de los oficiales y soldados del EPC, la clase obrera, los trabajadores agricolas, los jovenes y estudiantes y las mujeres.
					
					  Los oradores dijeron que es el prototipo de inmaduro y estupido el raton Lee Myung Bak que crecio en suelo japones asimilando la astucia y mezquindad de baratillero y se atrevio a calificar de producto de la "carrera armamentista" el lanzamiento de satelite artificial con fines pacificos de la RPDC como lacayo mimado de sus amos gringo y japones.
					
					  No vale la pena siquiera conseguir la disculpa de Lee con una cara de rata que da lastima, ridiculizaron.
					
					  Le convendria suicidarse ahora mismo, como demanda la opinion publica, para salir de su miserable situacion de basura apestosa, aconsejaron.
					
					  Prosiguieron que si se perdona al ratoncito Lee Myung Bak, que toma el enfrentamiento fratricida como su modo de subsistencia, no se puede mejorar las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas ni salvar a la nacion de los desastres.
					
					  Los reaccionarios vejetes iguales a las medias rotas de mendigo, los deformados estudiantes gangsteres y los medios de prensa ultraderechistas y conservadores del Sur de Corea, que actuan con tanta imprudencia ligados a la cola del ratoncito Lee, estan tambien en la mirilla de los fusiles del monte Paektu que no conocen piedad, afirmaron.
					
					  La defensa al lider a costa de la vida es nuestro maximo principio y en esta cuestion no se acepta ningun regateo, dijeron y apuntaron que la horda de ratones de Lee, cadaver vivo, probara lo que es la sentencia final.
					
					  Seguidamente, se realizaron las marchas de denuncia.
